p:
A target cell limited model was sufficient to capture the viral kinetic of the acute infection, consistent with the fact that IFN response is impaired in these animals.
68 Viral kinetics in untreated animals was characterized by an exponential growth of virus until D8 followed by rapid death, leading to an estimated R 0 of 9, which suggests that a treatment efficacy larger than 90% would be needed to block viral replication. Viral growth was accompanied with high levels of transaminases,
33 suggesting a large cell loss, and accordingly the half‐life of infected cells was short and estimated to about 6 hours (e.g., δ = 2.6/day).
